content: quote: Originally posted by threerings: I cant. Its like watching a car crash...I just cant look away from this...this... I'll work with you on this threerings. First clear your mind. Breathe deeply. OK, now pick-up your remote, point it at the TV & press either "channel up" or "channel down". It doesn't matter you're in control. Look at all the different channels! See all the different programs? Closer what Closer?!? Like shadows disappearing as you turn on the light in a dark room! Isn't this liberating??? My work is done here.

content: What I do not do is watch the stupid network programming aside from some sports and the occasional decent movie. I never watch the news or weather either. I prefer to get that info from newspapers. Usually I only need to read the first few lines to get the gist of the story or weather and don't have to sit through a long boring report. There is a plethora of newspapers, in English and free from around the world. I very much enjoy reading what people in other places think of events here and around the world. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?

content: If it wasn't for the History Channel, the Travel Channel, and the Military Channel, I wouldn't watch much TV. content: quote: Originally posted by threerings: I cant. Its like watching a car crash...I just cant look away from this...this... I'll work with you on this threerings. First clear your mind. Breathe deeply. OK, now pick-up your remote, point it at the TV & press either "channel up" or "channel down". It doesn't matter you're in control. Look at all the different channels! See all the different programs? Closer what Closer?!? Like shadows disappearing as you turn on the light in a dark room! Isn't this liberating??? My work is done here.
quote: Originally posted by threerings: I cant. Its like watching a car crash...I just cant look away from this...this...

content: quote: Do what I did - stop watching television. You'd be amazed at how much you can get done when you don't sit stunned in front of that box for hours on end. Spot on! I no longer sit stunned in front of a TV for hours on end. I now sit stunned in front of a computer monitor for hours on end. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?

content: What I do not do is watch the stupid network programming aside from some sports and the occasional decent movie. I never watch the news or weather either. I prefer to get that info from newspapers. Usually I only need to read the first few lines to get the gist of the story or weather and don't have to sit through a long boring report. There is a plethora of newspapers, in English and free from around the world. I very much enjoy reading what people in other places think of events here and around the world. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
